questions.text: How would you rate the overall quality of your organization's data assets?

options.text: Poor - Significant data quality issues are common
Fair - Some data quality issues exist
Good - Generally high quality with occasional issues
Excellent - Consistently high quality data across the organization

questions.text: What processes do you have in place for data validation and cleaning?

options.text: No formal processes
Basic data cleaning during analysis
Standardized validation and cleaning workflows
Automated data quality monitoring and remediation pipelines

questions.text: How mature is your organization's data governance framework?

options.text: No formal governance framework
Basic policies exist but implementation is inconsistent
Established framework with clear roles and responsibilities
Comprehensive framework integrated with business operations

questions.text: How do you manage data access and security?

options.text: Limited controls, primarily open access
Basic role-based access controls
Fine-grained access policies with regular audits
Zero-trust model with continuous monitoring and adaptive controls

questions.text: How would you describe your data infrastructure's readiness for AI applications?

options.text: Not designed for AI workloads
Basic capabilities with significant limitations
Capable infrastructure that handles most AI needs
Purpose-built for advanced AI with scalability and flexibility

questions.text: What level of integration exists between your data systems?

options.text: Mostly siloed data systems
Some integration but significant manual effort required
Well-integrated systems with standardized data flows
Fully connected data ecosystem with real-time synchronization
